event.title: 1908, a group of local women protested

data.event: In 1908, a group of local women protested the dumping of Berkeley garbage in their community.

event.title: confronted the drivers of the wagons near what is now

data.event: Armed with two shotguns and a twenty-two-caliber rifle, they confronted the drivers of the wagons near what is now the corner of San Pablo Avenue and Buchanan Street.
In 1909, voters changed the name of the city, primarily to distinguish the city from the adjacent section of Berkeley which had previously been named Ocean View.
